Description: Lid sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl with part of flange and root of knob; interior reserved; exterior white-slipped, from centre: around the knob, band of billets between pairs of narrow bands; tongue pattern frieze and two narrow bands; black-figure decoration consisting of frieze of geese to left (from left, head missing of walking goose; second goose with wings open; third goose grazing; traces of added red on wings and tail feathers); incised pendant, rising and full rosettes as filling ornament; two narrow bands; band of rays around edge of lid.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group A of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The decoration on the vases from this group is the most elaborate. The rosette has a standard cogwheel shape and the figures are carefully drawn and details are expertly incised.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 141, p. 147, p. 313, no. 1333, pl. 172)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2074) (phase 2)
